alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:33AM CDT until June 24 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR GREELEY...WESTERN NANCE...EASTERN VALLEY...WEST CENTRAL MERRICK...NORTHEASTERN SHERMAN AND HOWARD COUNTIES... At 232 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Bartlett to 6 miles west of Greeley to near Ashton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. Several mesonet sites have reported gusts of 55 to 65 MPH, with a peak gust of 68 MPH measured at the Ord Airport at 214 AM CDT. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Greeley around 240 AM CDT. Elba around 245 AM CDT. St. Paul around 255 AM CDT. Cushing around 300 AM CDT. Palmer around 305 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Sherman; Valley
